text: what's up guys Drew Pinsky here in
Manila I am back home for a few weeks
before heading to Africa for the rest of
2019 in today's video I wanted to share
with you five useful travel hacks and I
picked up from traveling to over 170
countries and I think will make your
life a lot easier on the road so let's
jump right into it the first thing I
want to share with you is to ask to sit
in the front of the airplane when you
arrive at the airport
so a lot of airlines are gonna try to
overcharge you like twenty to fifty
dollars for booking your seat online but
just booked any random seat and then
when you get to the airport you can
always say hey I want to sit towards the
front of the plane and they'll always
book it for your window or aisle the
chances of the flight being sold out are
really slim and then when the plane
arrives you can be the first one out
which is really important if you are
flying internationally because you can
run and get to immigration first so you
don't have to wait in a long line of
passengers hack number two is also at
the airport if you don't want to check
your bag then simply just distract the
airline representative and don't let her
weigh your bag so I have a backpack it's
always over the a kilogram limit it's
usually probably fifteen or fourteen so
I just keep it on my back end in my
smaller bag I keep on my foot so it's
hidden and then when I go up there the
first thing I tell her is I'm not
checking any bag so then she already
knows and she wants to see it I just
show her on my back but I never actually
have to weigh the back because if I
weigh it they're gonna want to check it
and it's so easy to distract them
distractible conversation and be like oh
this Airport is super busy right now or
where the people or you look really
pretty today say whatever you want just
to get them to like you because their
jobs are pretty boring let's be honest
hack number three is to utilize Google
maps offline
there's also another app called map stab
me but I find Google Maps to be better
because it's Google so it doesn't matter
where you are in the world all you have
to do is go to the search bar and type
in okay maps boom when you type in okay
Maps it comes up is the whole city right
here and then you just hit download
download now you can do it in Wi-Fi at
the hotel or anywhere that you are and
that's it you have the entire map
offline so you can track the GPS ticker
you can find your restaurants find your
cafe it's the best thing you can
possibly do Travel hack number four is
to always find Wi-Fi passwords by using
Foursquare Foursquare is basically a
website or an app where people can share
reviews and tips for different
restaurants bars hotels whatever and if
you scroll down to the tips section
people often share the Wi-Fi password
and I'm telling you you can get Wi-Fi
passwords for almost any Hotel any
restaurant any cafe it's all there on
Foursquare check it out and last but not
least travel hack number five is to
always travel with an empty water bottle
and just refill it at the airport
there's usually refill stations or you
just take it to Starbucks in the airport
or you take it to the lounge and you
refill it with water this will save the
environment so you don't have to keep
buying water bottles it will quench your
thirst because everyone to serve see in
airports and especially on airplanes you
want to bring your own water on because
it takes them forever to bring it and
they usually give you tiny cups so
always stay hydrated alright guys that's
it for today five useful travel hacks if
I missed anything if you guys want to
share your travel hacks please comment
below I want to hear other useful tips
that all of us travelers can benefit
from hope you guys had a wonderful
weekend and I will see you guys tomorrow
from Manila Cheers
I'm drivin ski and if you like my travel
videos please click Subscribe and join
me as I plan to visit every country in
the world
